jobDescription: Under the supervision of UC Davis and the general direction of the CDPH Meaningful Use (MU) Coordinator, the Data Systems Analyst's responsibilities include staffing a cross-program working group and designing a statewide communication plan for key partners to meet meaningful use public health reporting requirements.REQUIRED--Education: Master's Degree in a discipline related to data science, epidemiology, informatics, public health, or equivalent is preferred--Skills to use common software products (Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook); use of phone, email, fax, and other telecommunication methods; and analysis of business process to identify areas for quality improvement--Experience using health information systems, large databases, electronic data transfer methods, and software query, reporting, and analytical tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, SAS)--Experience using health data messaging and reporting standards, and interoperability best practices (e.g., HL7, SOAP/Web services, Meaningful Use).--Knowledge of health data privacy and security requirements; including statutes, regulations, technical safeguards, physical safeguards, legal agreements, and other requirements that govern data access and sharing--Experience writing technical reports, workflow documents, and general communications (e.g., memos, administrative procedure manuals, external communications)--Experience developing goals and project plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish responsibilities--Experience facilitating meetings; presenting on topics related to health information systems, data sharing, data standards and interoperability; and communicate effectively to garner cooperation among internal and external partners--Ability to use independent judgment, decision making, and problem solving to perform technical, operational, and administrative functionsSPECIAL REQUIREMENT - THIS POSITION MAY BE SUBJECT TO A CRIMINAL BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION, DRUG SCREEN, LIVE SCAN FINGERPRINTING, MEDICAL EVALUATION CLEARANCE, AND FUNCTIONAL CAPACITY ASSESSMENT
